original_title: 38th Annual Conference of the Organisation of Professional Associations of Sri Lanka
original_body_lines: The Organisation of Professional Associations of Sri Lanka (OPA), established in 1975, serves as the apex body representing Sri Lanka’s professional community. With 52 member associations spanning 34 disciplines, including Law, Medicine, Engineering, Accountancy, Supply Chain Management, Architecture, and Banking ,the OPA is a unifying platform for over 60,000 professionals.

The OPA’s core mission is to leverage the collective expertise of Sri Lanka’s professionals to contribute to national development, foster professional excellence, and promote ethical leadership across sectors.
We are pleased to announce the 38th Annual Conference of the OPA, the signature event of our calendar, scheduled for the 19th and 20th of August 2025 at Cinnamon Life, Colombo.

This year’s conference is of special significance as it will also feature the 4th National Apex Awards, honouring Sri Lanka’s most exemplary professionals for their lifetime achievements and outstanding contributions to their respective fields and to the nation.

Through this media briefing, we aim to convey the theme, objectives, and national relevance of the conference while inviting widespread participation and collaboration from Sri Lanka’s professional and business communities.

In the context of an evolving global landscape, this theme emphasizes the critical need for Sri Lanka’s professionals and institutions to strengthen resilience, adapt dynamically, and lead transformation.
The conference will commence with an inaugural ceremony attended by over 300 distinguished professionals, representing member associations, academia, and industry.
The Guest of Honour will be Dr. Harshana Suriyapperuma, Secretary to the Ministry of Finance, who will deliver the Keynote Address.
The 4th National Apex Awards will also be conferred during the inaugural session, celebrating excellence and lifelong contributions to the professions and the nation.

The second day will feature five Technical Sessions, led by eminent personalities from industry and academia. Each session has been carefully curated to address key areas of national and professional importance.
Interactive Q&A sessions (20 minutes), moderated by the respective Session Chairpersons
